sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Sale Price Ad Act.

sections.heading: Whenever a seller advertises that consumer
sections.text:
goods are for sale and that advertisement states the price of the
consumer goods, the stated price must include all services incidental
to the proper use of the goods by the purchaser, or the ad must state
clearly that such services will be furnished at extra cost.

sections.heading: Whenever a seller advertises that consumer goods
sections.text:
are for sale without stating a price, but with words such as "prices
reduced", "1/3 off", "50% off" or words of similar meaning, such ad
shall clearly state whether services incidental to the proper use of the
goods will require an extra charge.

sections.heading: Disclosure of discounted price; grocery stores; supermarkets.
sections.text: Disclosure of discounted price; grocery stores; supermarkets.

sections.heading: Violation of this Act is a business offense with
sections.text: a fine not to exceed $25. A person or retail mercantile establishment shall not be fined in excess of $500 per year for violations under this Act.
